      • findGlobal

        public static Optional<Path> findGlobal()
        Locate the path to the global configuration file
        Returns:
        path where global configuration is stored.

      • findXdg

        public static Optional<Path> findXdg()
        Locate the path to the global configuration file

        The user or global configuration file is usually located in `$HOME/.gitconfig`.

        This method will try to guess the full path to that file, if the file exists. The returned path may be used on any `git_config` call to load the global configuration file.

        This method will not guess the path to the xdg compatible config file (.config/git/config).

        Returns:
        the path to the global configuration file or empty
        Throws:
        GitException - git errors

      • findSystem

        public static Optional<Path> findSystem()
        Locate the path to the system configuration file

        If /etc/gitconfig doesn't exist, it will look for %PROGRAMFILES%\Git\etc\gitconfig.

        Returns:
        found config file
        Throws:
        GitException - git errors

      • findProgramdata

        public static Optional<Path> findProgramdata()
        Locate the path to the configuration file in ProgramData

        Look for the file in %PROGRAMDATA%\Git\config used by portable git.

        Returns:
        the path to the configuration file in ProgramData
        Throws:
        GitException - git errors

      • openDefault

        public static Config openDefault()

      • newConfig

        public static Config newConfig()

      • addFileOndisk

        public void addFileOndisk(Path path,
                          Config.ConfigLevel level,
                          Repository repo,
                          boolean force)
        Add an on-disk config file instance to an existing config

        The on-disk file pointed at by `path` will be opened and parsed; it's expected to be a native Git config file following the default Git config syntax (see man git-config).

        If the file does not exist, the file will still be added and it will be created the first time we write to it.

        Note that the configuration object will free the file automatically.

        Further queries on this config object will access each of the config file instances in order (instances with a higher priority level will be accessed first).

        Parameters:
        path - path to the configuration file to add
        level - the priority level of the backend
        force - replace config file at the given priority level
        repo - optional repository to allow parsing of conditional includes
        Throws:
        GitException - 0 on success, GIT_EEXISTS when adding more than one file for a given priority level (and force_replace set to 0), GIT_ENOTFOUND when the file doesn't exist or error code

      • openOndisk

        public static Config openOndisk(Path path)
        Create a new config instance containing a single on-disk file

        This method is a simple utility wrapper for the following sequence of calls: - git_config_new - git_config_add_file_ondisk

        Parameters:
        path - Path to the on-disk file to open
        Returns:
        the configuration instance opened
        Throws:
        GitException - git errors

      • openLevel

        public static Config openLevel(Config.ConfigLevel level,
                               Config parent)
        Build a single-level focused config object from a multi-level one.

        The returned config object can be used to perform get/set/delete operations on a single specific level.

        Getting several times the same level from the same parent multi-level config will return different config instances, but containing the same config_file instance.

        Parameters:
        parent - Multi-level config to search for the given level
        level - Configuration level to search for
        Returns:
        The configuration instance opened or null if the passed level cannot be found in the multi-level parent config
        Throws:
        GitException - git errors

      • openGlobal

        public static Config openGlobal(Config config)

      • snapshot

        public Config snapshot()
        Create a snapshot of the configuration

        Create a snapshot of the current state of a configuration, which allows you to look into a consistent view of the configuration for looking up complex values (e.g. a remote, submodule).

        The string returned when querying such a config object is valid until it is freed.

        Returns:
        configuration to snapshot
        Throws:
        GitException - git errors

      • getBool

        public Optional<Boolean> getBool(String name)
        Get the value of a boolean config variable.

        All config files will be looked into, in the order of their defined level. A higher level means a higher priority. The first occurrence of the variable will be returned here.

        Parameters:
        name - the variable's name
        Returns:
        bool value of name or empty if not found
        Throws:
        GitException - git errors

      • getString

        public Optional<String> getString(String name)
        Get the value of a string config variable.
        Parameters:
        name - the variable's name
        Returns:
        value of a string config variable

      • getStringBuf

        public Optional<Buf> getStringBuf(String name)
        Get the value of a string config variable.

        The value of the config will be copied into the buffer.

        All config files will be looked into, in the order of their defined level. A higher level means a higher priority. The first occurrence of the variable will be returned here.

        Parameters:
        name - the variable's name
        Returns:
        value of string config variable
        Throws:
        GitException - git errors
